block.p: Penelope Clarkson Scott, a daughter of Elizabeth and Henry C. Scott of Brookfield, Conn., was married on Friday to Michael Andrew Sullivan, a son of Patricia and Gregory A. Sullivan of Rumson, N.J. The Rev. Robert B. O'Connor performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Blessed Sacrament in New York.

Mrs. Sullivan, 27, is a recruiting associate in the Greenwich, Conn., office of Heidrick & Struggles, the executive search firm. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in school psychology from the University of Delaware.

Penelope Clarkson Scott, a daughter of Elizabeth and Henry C. Scott of Brookfield, Conn., was married on Friday to Michael Andrew Sullivan, a son of Patricia and Gregory A. Sullivan of Rumson, N.J. The Rev. Robert B. O'Connor performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Blessed Sacrament in New York.

Mrs. Sullivan, 27, is a recruiting associate in the Greenwich, Conn., office of Heidrick & Struggles, the executive search firm. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in school psychology from the University of Delaware.

Her father retired as a sales and marketing manager in the educational division of Grolier Inc., the publisher in Danbury, Conn. Her mother is an administrative assistant in Danbury with the information technology department of Boehringer Ingelheim, a German pharmaceuticals manufacturer.

Mr. Sullivan, 28, was until last week an assistant vice president and stock trader at J.&W. Seligman & Company, a money management business in New York. Next month, he is to become an associate in the sales, trading and research department at Lehman Brothers, the New York investment bank. He graduated from Boston College and received an M.B.A. degree from New York University in May.

The bridegroom's father is a sales manager for high-yield bonds in the Roseland, N.J., office of BNY Capital Markets, a subsidiary of the Bank of New York. The bridegroom's mother is a manager of the Veranda, a gift shop in Fair Haven, N.J. The bridegroom's great-grandfather Henry Heide was the founder of the candy company bearing his name, which originated Jujubes and Jujyfruits.
